description: The year this resource was published. Just uses the year part of the `published_date`.
name: year

description: The type of resource, currently identical to the Crossref-reported type of a given resource. Here, only the `journal-article` type is considered, but there are many others.
name: genre

description: Time when the data for this resource was last updated. Returned as an ISO8601-formatted timestamp. Example: `2017-08-17T23:43:27.753663`
name: updated

description: The date this resource was published, as  reported by the publishers, who unfortunately have inconsistent definitions of what counts as officially `published.` Returned as an ISO8601-formatted timestamp, generally with only year-month-day.
name: published_date

description: Indicates whether this resource is published in a DOAJ-indexed journal.
name: journal_is_in_doaj

description: Indicates whether this resource published in a completely OA journal. Under construction. Included for future compatibility. Will eventually include any fully-OA publication venue, regardless of inclusion in DOAJ.
name: journal_is_oa

description: Any ISSNs assigned to the journal publishing this resource.Separate ISSNs are sometimes assigned to print and electronic versions of the same journal. If there are multiple ISSNs, they are separated by commas. Separate ISSNs are sometimes assigned to print and electronic versions of the same journal. If there are multiple ISSNs, they are separated by commas. Example: `1232-1203,1532-6203`
name: journal_issns

description: The OA Location object describes particular place where we found a given OA article. The same article is often available from multiple locations, and there may be differences in format, version, and license depending on the location; the OA Location object describes these key attributes. An OA Location Object is always a Child of a DOI Object.

fields.description: The url_for_pdf if there is one; otherwise landing page URL.
fields.name: url

fields.description: How Unpaywall found this OA location. Used for debugging. Do not depend on the exact contents of this for anything, because values are subject to change without warning. Example values: `oa journal (via journal title in doaj)`:  name of the journal that publishes this article found in the DOAJ database; `oa repository (via pmcid lookup)`: article found in an index of PubMed Central articles.
fields.name: evidence

fields.description: OAI-PMH endpoint where we found this location. This is primarily for internal debugging. It's `Null` for locations that weren't found using OAI-PMH.
fields.name: pmh_id

fields.description: Is this location the `best_oa_location` for its resource.
fields.name: is_best

fields.description: The license under which this copy is published, returns several types of licenses: Creative Commons licenses are uniformly abbreviated and lowercased (Example: `cc-by-nc`); Publisher-specific licenses are normalized using this format: `acs-specific: authorchoice/editors choice usage agreement`; When we have evidence that an OA license of some kind was used, but it is not reported directly on the webpage at this location, this field returns `implied-oa`.
fields.name: license

fields.description: Time when the data for this location was last updated. Returned as an ISO8601-formatted timestamp. Example: `2017-08-17T23:43:27.753663`
fields.name: updated

fields.description: The content version accessible at this location. Unpaywall uses the DRIVER Guidelines v2.0 VERSION standard to define versions of a given article; see those docs for complete definitions of terms. Here's the basic idea, though, for the three version types they support: `submittedVersion` is not yet peer-reviewed; `acceptedVersion` is peer-reviewed, but lacks publisher-specific formatting; `publishedVersion` is the version of record.
fields.name: version

fields.description: The type of host that serves this OA location. There are two possible values: `publisher` means the this location is served by the article's publisher (in practice, this means it is hosted on the same domain the DOI resolves to); `repository` means this location is served by an Open Access repository.
fields.name: host_type

fields.description: The URL with a PDF version of this OA copy.
fields.name: url_for_pdf

fields.description: The URL for a landing page describing this OA copy. When the `host_type` is `publisher` the landing page usually includes HTML fulltext.
fields.name: url_for_landing_page

name: oa_locations

description: The DOI of this resource. This is always lowercase.
name: doi

description: Indicates whether there is an OA copy of this resource.
name: is_oa

description: The name of this resource's publisher. Keep in mind that publisher name strings change over time, particularly as publishers are acquired or split up.
name: publisher

description: The name of the journal publishing this resource. The same journal may have multiple name strings (eg, `J. Foo`, "Journal of Foo", "JOURNAL OF FOO", etc). These have not been fully normalized within the database, so use with care.
name: journal_name

description: Indicates the data collection approaches used for this resource. Possible values are `1` for first-generation hybrid detection. Uses only data from the Crossref API to determine hybrid status. Does a good job for Elsevier articles and a few other publishers, but most publishers are not checked for hybrid; `2` for second-generation hybrid detection. Uses additional sources, checks all publishers for hybrid. Gets about 10x as much hybrid, version used in the paper about the Unpaywall dataset.
name: data_standard
